intro: Mammillaria elongata var. stella-aurata, commonly known as the Starry Star Cactus, is a compact, globular cactus with a distinctive appearance. It features white, star-shaped tubercles that give it its name, and it typically grows to a height of about 10-15 centimeters. The plant has a grayish-green stem with a woolly texture, and it produces yellow flowers in the spring. It is native to Mexico and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor collections. This variety is relatively easy to care for, requiring minimal water and moderate temperatures.
